image.altText: A woman with her back to the camera walking next to a plain-clothed police detective.

props.synopsis: Police will allege that toddler Diana Jane Hanbury was denied medical intervention from her parents which caused her death in north Queensland in 2022.

title.children: Parents of two-year-old girl charged with murder

image.altText: Sally McManus holding a report, standing next to Professor Allan Fels.

props.synopsis: The former chair of the ACCC takes aim at electricity providers, banks, airlines, supermarkets, and other big businesses in his new report on price gouging and unfair pricing practices.

title.children: Price gouging report finds big businesses are exploiting Australians

image.altText: Maree Crabtree smiles as she stands with city buildings behind her.

props.synopsis: A Gold Coast mother accused of killing her son with a poisoned fruit smoothie has walked free on bail after her murder trial was aborted due to fresh evidence.

title.children: Gold Coast mother walks free on bail after six years behind bars accused of her son's murder, attempted murder

image.altText: woman and man holding ornate glass urn

props.synopsis: The urn containing ashes was lost in Cairns two weeks ago after being stashed in a microwave that had been donated to flood victims. It took a little help from local radio before it could be reunited with the family.

title.children: Urn containing ashes reunited with family who'd stored them in microwave sent to flood victims

image.altText: A 70-year-old woman with shoulder length brown hair sitting down.

props.synopsis: Premier Steven Miles has flagged raising the prospect of opening children's court to the media with the Attorney-General after access was denied in relation to the alleged murder of Vyleen White.

title.children: Shopping centre stabbing prompts premier to call for better media access to children's court

image.altText: A split shot of a woman in  a dress and in running gear.

props.synopsis: Police say items recovered during a search of bushland near the home of missing Ballarat East woman Samantha Murphy are not related to her whereabouts.

title.children: Items recovered during search for missing Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy not related to case

image.altText: A close up of a person's hands, one holding an iPhone and one holding a small flip phone.

props.synopsis: With mobile phone use on the rise, some people are turning to simpler devices to help them cut down on their screen time.

title.children: Sick of doomscrolling and being 'constantly on call', these Australians switched to a 'dumbphone'

image.altText: Mine infrastructure in a coalfield, blue sky.

props.synopsis: Whitehaven Coal's Winchester South coal mine in central Queensland's Bowen Basin plans to extract up to 17 million tonnes of coal a year for about 30 years.

title.children: Environmentalist slams approval of one of largest proposed greenfield coal mines

image.altText: A North Queensland Cowboys player holding a football while running

props.synopsis: Cowboys forward Luciano Leilua has pleaded guilty to low-range drink driving before a Townsville magistrate.

title.children: NRL star suspended from driving after blowing over alcohol limit

image.altText: Outside of Maroochydore courthouse

props.synopsis: The 12-year-old girl, who has been placed on a support plan under the National Disability Insurance Scheme after being recently diagnosed with autism, is facing charges of deprivation of liberty and the assault of a 13-year-old girl.

title.children: Girl accused of torturing and filming alleged assault of child in Noosa granted bail

image.altText: George Christensen holds a megaphone, surrounded by people.

props.synopsis: Controversial former federal MP George Christensen has thrown his hat in the ring to nominate for a seat in Queensland's  March local government election.

title.children: Controversial former MP George Christensen stages political comeback

image.altText: Ambulance vehicle outside high school.

props.synopsis: An ambulance spokesman says the students reportedly ingested an unknown substance from a bag, and paramedics arrived to find one of the teens vomiting.

title.children: Six students from Townsville high school rushed to hospital after ingesting 'brownish' powder

image.altText: An image of a young man smiling into a camera while wearing a tuxedo, city lights beyond the river.

props.synopsis: A preliminary report suggests hypoxia could be the reason three aerial firefighting crew members, including 22-year-old William Jennings from the US, died when their plane crashed in rural Queensland in November.

title.children: Lack of oxygen could have caused fatal plane crash that killed three people: ATSB

image.altText: Hands holding a stamped passport.

props.synopsis: The Passport Office will overhaul its passport application processes after an audit finds it knew there would be a surge in demand for passports after the pandemic, and should have planned for it.

title.children: Passport Office mismanaged 'pent up demand' for travel documents, audit finds

image.altText: A childhood photo of David, Rex and Marilyn Wallman

props.synopsis: Marilyn Joy Wallman was 14 when she vanished from an isolated stretch of road while riding her bicycle in Mackay. More than 50 years later, her family is desperate for answers.

title.children: New inquest to seek answers over suspected kidnapping, murder of Queensland schoolgirl in 1972

image.altText: Rescuers work at the site of a Russian missile strike.

props.synopsis: The number of Ukrainians dying from burn injuries is surging, according to doctors from the war-ravaged nation pleading with the Australian government to send extra medical support to eastern Europe.

title.children: Plea for Australian burns expertise to help Ukrainian resistance

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaking with his arms held out.

props.synopsis: The coalition continued to question the prime minister's integrity after the backflip on stage 3 tax cuts as members of parliament were told to "stop making so much noise".

title.children: Tax cuts, integrity and 'far too much noise' dominate Question Time on second sitting day — as it happened

image.altText: Unidentified image of two police officers in uniform

props.synopsis: A police officer facing rape and assault charges is committed to stand trial in the Northern Territory Supreme Court, with a local court judge finding there is "sufficient evidence" against him.

title.children: NT police officer faces Supreme Court trial on rape, choking and aggravated assault charges

image.altText: Phoebe is seen in a polaroid smiling with her tongue out, overlaid on top of an image of her Queenslander installation.

props.synopsis: Brisbane artist Phoebe Paradise turns the tension between Queenslander houses and their environment into works of gothic, sci-fi art.

title.children: Who gets to stay above the flood line in Brisbane? This question consumes Phoebe Paradise

image.altText: Headshot of a young man with a moustache wearing prison greens.

props.synopsis: Kingsley Pickett, who killed pregnant mother Margaret Blurton and her baby son in a 1991 high-speed crash and earned a reputation as WA's worst serial offender, is being released on a supervision order.

title.children: Killer rapist who took lives of pregnant mum and toddler son set to be freed from jail

image.altText: Sparse traffic on Story Bridge in Brisbane city towards Kangaroo Point during COVID-19 lockdown

props.synopsis: The Greens pledge to push for trams to come back to Brisbane if they gain power at next month's council election, as the LNP prepares to announce more details about its Metro expansion plan.

title.children: Greens announce $10m light rail study in Brisbane election pitch as LNP flags Metro expansion

image.altText: Coles and Woolworths branding outside neighbouring supermarkets

props.synopsis: Coles and Woolworths point to increased prices from suppliers as one of the reasons for painful increases to supermarket prices, as the supermarkets offer defences to a federal inquiry into the issue.

title.children: Coles and Woolworths make their defence on supermarket prices to Senate inquiry

image.altText: Police cars parked in a driveway near a crime scene

props.synopsis: The man allegedly shot a 29-year-old Deception Bay woman inside a unit complex before calling triple-0.

title.children: Police charge 18yo with murder over shooting north of Brisbane

image.altText: A jail booking photo of Ethan Crumbley beside his mother Jennifer Crumbley and dad James Crumbley.

props.synopsis: The guilty conviction of the Michigan school shooter's mother sets a "contentious" precedent for holding parents accountable for their child's wrongdoings, a US legal expert says.

title.children: Why Jennifer Crumbley was held responsible for her teenage son's mass school shooting

image.altText: Marape

props.synopsis: Papua New Guinea's Prime Minister James Marape has arrived in Canberra ahead of a historic address at Parliament House, but a political storm is continuing to brew at home in Port Moresby.

title.children: Deadly riots, China's expanding ties to the Pacific and a no confidence vote loom large ahead of historic speech

image.altText: A picture of a sign that says 'Daisy Hill Conservation Park and Koala Centre' with trees and a road in the background.

props.synopsis: The state government purchases a large parcel of land that will be added to the Daisy Hill Conservation Park, which features mountain bike tracks, walking paths, picnic areas, horse riding trails, and a koala centre.

title.children: Major conservation park home to koalas near Brisbane to grow by 213 hectares

image.altText: King Charles waves to a crowd as Queen Camilla walks ahead.

props.synopsis: When Charles became king, he moved to expand the number of counsellors of state who could carry out his duties if he were to become seriously ill. The move may have foreshadowed this exact scenario, saving him from potentially awkward speculation about what role Prince Harry and Prince Andrew could play while he recovers.

title.children: How a quiet move by King Charles may have saved him — and Prince Harry — an awkward media circus

image.altText: Whale shark swimming by back of a boat

props.synopsis: The two men did not know whale sharks could be found in waters off Queensland's south-east coast until the inquisitive creature glided up next to their boat.

title.children: Sea sickness puts fishermen in path of rare whale shark off K'gari
